conclusion: Light source is positioned at a certain angle relative to the objects.
Shadows A, B, C, and D are cast on the ground due to the obstruction of light by the objects.
Moving the light source forward means it gets closer to the objects while maintaining its height.
Shadows will move closer to the objects because the light rays are now coming from a more frontal direction.
Shadows A, B, C, and D will shift towards the objects, reducing the distance between the objects and their respective shadows.
Shadows will become smaller because the light rays are hitting the objects more directly, reducing the spread of the shadow.
Shadow A moves closer to the bowl and becomes smaller.
Shadow B moves closer to the blue object and becomes smaller.
Shadow C moves closer to the pink object and becomes smaller.
Shadow D moves closer to the waffle sandwich and becomes smaller.
If the light source moves forward above the objects, the shadows A, B, C, and D will shift closer to their respective objects and decrease in size.
